alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Central and Southern Valley; Daniels; Garfield; McCone; Northern Phillips; Northern Valley; Prairie; Western Roosevelt (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 9:58PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Phillips, Garfield, western Daniels, western Roosevelt, Valley, McCone and northwestern Prairie Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 957 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of Whitewater to 7 miles southeast of Edwards. Movement was northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glasgow, Wolf Point, Malta, Circle, Jordan, Opheim, Whitewater, Richland, Nashua, Fort Peck, Saco, Sand Springs, Duck Creek Rec Area, Hillside, Hell Creek Rec Area, Flowing Wells Rest Area, Peerless, Hinsdale, Lustre and Port Of Morgan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM MDT for northeastern Montana.
